page.name: Free technology applications for literacy skills
page.content:
Many times, learners don't know what tools are available to help improve literacy skills. Share these resources with your students and ask them to make a "pros" and "cons" list for each technology. Use this activity to build literacy skills, by asking learners to orally communicate their list with their peers or with the class. 

  • Google Read & Write — Students can access a range of powerful support tools to help gain confidence with reading, writing, studying, and research, including:
    Text-to-speech to hear words, passages, or whole documents read aloud with easy-to-follow dual color highlightingText and picture dictionaries to see the meaning of words explained
  • Flip — Students record themselves speaking into the camera. They can then record a video response or leave a written comment for other videos they view.
  • Voki — Students select a character and can speak to record their voice or type a response and select a character to read it for them.
  • Google Docs & Slides — Students can collaborate on a writing activity in real-time or provide one another feedback using the comment feature.

Go back to the Try It Yourself Section for a list of all Try it Yourself Options.
